items.title: Bondi hero Ahmed Al Ahmed who wrestled gunman shares his story
items.description: Father-of-two Ahmed Al Ahmed, who risked his life to disarm one of the Bondi gunmen during a terrorist attack, says he feels sorry for the 15 people who were killed.

items.title: PM announces terms for review of Bondi terror attack
items.description: The PM says a former head of ASIO will assess whether multiple security and law agencies worked as effectively as they should have before the attack.

items.title: US offers Ukraine 15-year security guarantee as part of peace plan
items.description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy has held talks with US President Donald Trump, and says he would prefer a commitment of 50 years.

items.title: ICC hands down punishment for 'unsatisfactory' MCG pitch
items.description: The ICC has handed down their verdict on the controversial MCG pitch which led to this year's Boxing Day Test wrapping up after just two days.

items.title: Hamas confirms death of former leader, believed to have died in May
items.description: In a statement, the Palestinian militant group also confirmed the death of spokesman Abu Ubaida.

items.title: Family, colleagues in 'disbelief' after leading scientist dies aged 52
items.description: University of Melbourne vice-chancellor Emma Johnston has died from complications associated with cancer, aged 52.

items.title: South Australian MP Nick McBride to remain in custody for next seven days
items.description: South Australian independent MP Nick McBride will spend the next week in custody, after being arrested and charged over the weekend.

items.title: Certainty in the rearview mirror as 2025 economy goes wild
items.description: This year saw economies survive tariff shocks and markets burst through record highs, but it doesn't feel like a party because so many people aren't invited.

items.title: Stranded passengers to fly home from PNG after failed efforts to free cruise ship
items.description: Passengers on the Australian cruise ship stranded off the coast of Papua New Guinea will be flown out of the country after efforts to refloat the vessel failed.

items.title: 'You're levitating': Sailors tell of 'horrendous' ordeal in yacht race
items.description: Those now safely onshore after finishing the 2025 Sydney to Hobart tell of "horrendous" conditions, resulting in injuries, broken boats and seasickness — even among experienced crew members.

items.title: 'Pesky Aussie laws' comment sparks scrutiny of weight-loss treatment marketing
items.description: Eating disorder bodies are raising concerns about weight-loss treatments being prescribed by telehealth companies, one of which ran a Black Friday sale to promote its services.

items.title: China launches military exercise warning against Taiwan independence
items.description: China has moved its military to surround Taiwan warning against its independence. But Beijing's action has been condemned by Taiwan calling for regional peace and de-escalation.

items.title: Protesters unite for 'stinky display' against demersal fishing ban
items.description: Hundreds of kilograms of shark heads have been left dumped outside the WA Fisheries minister's office in Margaret River, just three days before a permanent commercial demersal fishing ban comes into effect.

items.title: Mother's fight for change continues 10 years after son's death in custody
items.description: A decade after his death in a Sydney prison, David Dungay Jr's family hold with a memorial rally calling for change to a corrections system they say still fails to protect Indigenous people.

items.title: Sydney Test a golden opportunity for Green to belatedly shine in Australia
items.description: He has already proven his quality away from home, but heading into the final Test of the Ashes summer, Cameron Green remains in search of his breakthrough moment in Australia.

items.title: Help the kids unwind with 'slow TV' that promotes quiet and calm
items.description: Looking for screen-time options that won't leave your kids overstimulated? 'Slow TV' shows, with their soothing visuals and soundtracks, could be the answer.

items.title: After Sarah Larcombe fell off Arapiles, healing her bones was just the beginning
items.description: When Sarah Larcombe fell off Mount Arapiles in February, she thought she just sprained her ankle. What followed was months of ups and downs ending in a stunning world championships result.

items.title: South Korea's former first lady allegedly received handbags, jewellery and art as bribes
items.description: Kim Keon Hee, the wife of disgraced ex-president Yoon Suk Yeol, is alleged to have accepted lavish bribes including fine art, jewellery and designer handbags, and to have meddled in state affairs.

items.title: Police investigate fire as man fights for life
items.description: A man has sustained life-threatening burns after a unit complex went up in flames in Cairns. Police continue to investigate the cause of the fire.

items.title: 'Air experience' student killed in crash during glider's launch phase
items.description: A woman in her 50s was taking an "air experience" flight along with an instructor when they crashed during the take-off towing phase, as her husband watched.

items.title: Legal loophole in double jeopardy cases closed after amendment
items.description: Last-minute amendments to Queensland's double jeopardy laws could allow for the retrial of botched DNA cases.

items.title: 'A dream come true': Father builds castle with moat and dungeon for son
items.description: They say "a man's home is his castle" but one builder from south-west Victoria has taken that literally when creating a dream home for his son.

items.title: NGOs fear lifesaving Gaza aid will be blocked under new Israeli rules
items.description: The Israeli government has introduced new rules for aid organisations, including that they must not engage in any activities or criticism which "delegitimise" the state of Israel.

items.title: England lose another quick for final Ashes Test
items.description: England's pace bowling stocks will be stretched to their absolute limit for the final Ashes Test with Gus Atkinson ruled out with a hamstring injury.

items.title: Inside Big Ben, a London icon that's been ringing since 1859
items.description: It's among the world's most photographed landmarks, a symbol of the United Kingdom and an engineering marvel. And for London's Big Ben the most important night of the year is fast approaching.
